page.title: 19SUTTON STAITHE
page.content: A wide channel leads from Barton Broad across what was once Sutton Broad to Sutton Staithe. Sutton Broad is now an area of reed bed. The staithe provides mooring for holiday craft visiting Sutton. This area of the staithe is village green. It has recently undergone extensive improvement. The channel has been dredged and the quay headings made good with timbers. The Sutton Staithe Hotel and Restaurant stands next to the village green. It is popular with people on the boats. This year a traction engine rally and summer fete was held on the staithe. The restaurant at the rear of the hotel can be hired for a variety of functions. The small bar at the hotel serves real ale and can be very cosy when the open fires are lit in the winter.
